Square Dance Cadence
by The Learning Station
From the CD, Kid's Country Song & Dance
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)

Lyrics
(Follow the directions, repeat each line, and answer YEA! in the choruses)
Stand up straight make a country line.
We’re all spruced up and looking fine.
Ya’ll do what I do and say what I say,
Country square dance, HIP HURRAY!
March in place and groove to the beat.
Clap and stomp your country feet.
Swing your lasso overhead.
Bring it down, now put it to bed.

Chorus: Can you feel it?-YEA! Can you do it?-YEA!
You want more? YEA! Square Dance till the cows come home.
Turn and face your partner friend.
Shake their hand and bow your head.
Now do-se-do and holler “Yay!”
Get on your horse and gallop away.
Stand in place and clap along.
Twiddle your thumbs to this song.
Girls all curtsy, boys please bow.
Tip your hat, wag your tail like a cow. Repeat Chorus
Bend your knees up and down.
Wiggle your shoulders all around.
Fiddle your banjo strings real fast.
Stomp one boot to the YEEHA BLAST!
Stand up straight, arms by your side.
Rock back and forth, like a PONY RIDE!
Swing your lasso shout YAHOO!
Climb off your horse and dust your shoe.
Hands on your waist, flap em’ around
Wag your tail feathers, to this sound.
Tell your partner HOWDY HO!
Spin around and do-se-do. Repeat Chorus
Bounce in place to the country beat.
Jump up high, then sit on your seat.
Turn to your partner one last time.
Shake their hand, here comes a rhyme.
Say twiddle dee, twiddle doo.
It’s been real fun square dancin’ with you!
Tip your hat for a proper goodbye.
A big country smile and the wink of an eye.
#thelearningstation #dancesongskids 
http://www.youtube.com/user/TheLearningStation

snippet.title: Kids Mindfulness | Brain Break | Meditation for Children
snippet.description:
This video helps kids learn how to release physical and emotional tension. We play a game where they make their bodies really tight, squeezing all of their muscles and then relax all of their muscles as much as possible. Games like this help to regulate kids' emotions through mindfulness exercises.  Follow along here on our guided mindfulness activity and you'll start learning a lifelong habit that has tremendous health benefits. Did you know that meditating for at least 10 mins a day helps achieve a happier mindset? Remember that learning any skill takes practice. Try to do at least one mindfulness exercise each day. 

Try another mindfulness activity:
https://youtu.be/_FoN0DlXKb0

Want to get some exercise? Try a fun cardio and strength routine:
https://youtu.be/nWVTe2HM55Y

Ready to have some fun? Dance it out with Bond! Learn this easy dance routine.
https://youtu.be/eTmoFKEuf8M

snippet.title: Brain Breaks | Rocky The Rock N Roll Raccoon | Beginning Letter Sounds | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Rocky the Rock 'n' Roll Raccoon is a fun brain breaks song as kids rock out with Rocky. This brain breaks song engages children with tons of fun movements that can help relieve classroom stress and get those wiggles out. 

Rocky the Rock 'n' Roll Raccoon is not only a great brain breaks activity, it's also a wonderful song to help children hear the beginning letter sound (R) Teachers and parents can use Rocky the Rock 'n' Roll Raccoon to help make learning about the letter sound (R) more fun. 

Alliteration of the beginning sound (R) continues throughout the whole song so your children really get to practice saying and hearing those (R's).
 
Rocky the Rock 'n' Roll Raccoon helps your children take a fun brain break, develop their phonological awareness and get some great exercise too.

Rocky the Rock 'n' Roll Raccoon is on Leaping Letter Songs: https://www.jackhartmann.com/album/alliteration-songs-leaping-letter-songs/

Lyrics

Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He rocks his guitar, man, he’s so cool Chorus 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes everybody rock out 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your hands rock, he makes your hands rock 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your knees rock, he makes your knees rock 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your hips rock, he makes your hips rock 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your head rock, he makes your head rock 
(Chorus) 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your shoulders rock, he makes your shoulders rock 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your elbows rock, he makes your elbows rock 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your bottom rock, he makes your bottom rock 
Rocky the Rock n’ Roll Raccoon 
He makes your arms rock, he makes your arms rock

snippet.title: On & Off - Flow | GoNoodle
snippet.description:
This exercise will teach you to turn high, stressful energy off so you can do what you need to do to be your best self.

This video comes from GoNoodle’s Flow channel. Flow gets kids to relax, think positive, and flow with mindfulness exercises. 


Create a free account on GoNoodle.com now and find hundreds of ways to move! -- http://goo.gl/3h3tKp

Have you subscribed to the GoNoodle YouTube channel? What are you waiting for!? Subscribe today for exclusive content! -- http://goo.gl/FkLrzy

About GoNoodle
GoNoodle gets kids moving to be their strongest, bravest, silliest, smartest, bestest selves. Over 10 million kids each month are dancing, stretching, running, jumping, deep breathing, and wiggling with GoNoodle at GoNoodle.com -- http://goo.gl/3h3tKp



Lyrics:
Sit back and rest. You can sit on the ground with your legs out straight and your back leaning against something. Or  you can sit in your chair, with your legs long, your feet flat on the floor while you lean against the back of your chair.  

Get comfortable. 

We’re going turn on the energy in our bodies. And then we’re going to be turning it off.  

Let’s begin with your toes. Wiggle your toes to wake them up. 

Ready? Tighten your toes, like you’re making a fist with them. Try to only turn on the power in  your toes, and let all other areas of your body rest. Breathe in while they are tight.

And then when you breathe out, turn the energy off. Let your toes rest. 

Again. Breathe in and turn the energy on in your toes...just your toes. Breathe out to turn it off and let the tightness go. 

Let’s give your legs a chance.  Turn on the energy in your legs, straighten them if that helps. 

Make tight, tense muscles. Now breathe in to add even more energy.  

Exhale and let go. Legs go soft. Power goes off. 

Let’s do one more round with legs. Ready? 

Start breathing in, turn the energy on, legs are working hard, tight, tense. 
Then turn that energy off, breathe out, relax , soften those muscles. 

You’re in control. 

Now your hands. Make fists and inhale as you turn your energy on, and then let’s exhale and rest. Turn it all off. 

Add your arms this time. They can be straight or bent. 
Make fists, arms get tight, energy ON, breathe in. 
Breathe out and let go. Energy OFF. 

Arms and hands one more time. Turn it on with an in breath, and turn it off with an outbreath. 

And finally, we’re going to try the  whole body. If you want, add your face muscles too - crinkle up your eyes, your lips, your cheeks.  

Ready? Breathe in and turn on your whole body’s energy...toes, feet, legs, hands, arms, face. Feel the energy in your body. It’s ON! 

And now turn it all off while you breathe out slowly. Relax. The energy’s off. 

See if you can stay still, just for a little.

Energy’s off. 

Notice how you might feel different in your body, now that you’ve practiced being in 
control of your very own on and off switch.

snippet.title: Go Bananas | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
We put a fun new beat to this popular children's favorite, Go Bananas. Go Bananas is  a wonderful brain breaks song your children can sing and move along with in the classroom, at home or at physical education. It is such a great brain breaks song because it's fun, easy and quick to do, and engages the children with lots of movement to get all those wiggles out.

Your children will love doing Go Bananas over and over again. This brain breaks song also has a positive message in it about how important fruits are for your physical and mental well being.

Children can follow my movements and be actively involved in all the actions for each fruit. (move arms like your forming the shape of the fruit, peeling the different fruit and having simple fun with all the other movements.)

Enjoy this brain breaks song through the whole year!

LYRICS:

Go Bananas

Form, form, form the banana
Peel, peel, peel the banana
Slice, slice, slice the banana
Go, Go, Go Bananas
Form, form, form the orange
Peel, peel, peel, the orange
Slice, slice, slice the orange
Squeeze, squeeze, squeeze the orange
Form, form, form the grapes
Pick, pick, pick the grapes
Stomp, stomp, stomp the grapes
Spread, spread, spread the jelly
Eat fruits every day, they help you work and play
They’re good for your skin and bones
And help you to grow
Fruits are so cool, you’ll do better at school
Go, Go, Go bananas, go!

snippet.description:
Help to regulate kids' emotions through mindfulness exercises. Starfish breathing uses embodied learning to help children learn to control their breath and be present in their bodies. Follow along here on our guided mindfulness activity and you'll start learning a lifelong habit that has tremendous health benefits. Did you know that meditating for at least 10 mins a day helps achieve a happier mindset. Remember that learning any skill takes practice. Try to do at least one mindfulness exercise each day.

snippet.title: Good Morning Song | A Beautiful Day | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
A Beautiful Day is a good morning song celebrating the start of a new day. Children sing the chorus together with me, raise their arms up, hold hands and sway with friends as they sing about so many beautiful things all around.

It's my favorite and most requested good morning song. Both children and teachers love it's uplifting spirit and rhythm. The main portion of this good morning song is a repeat after me pattern.

The entire good morning song engages children in fun movements as they sing along so it engages their body and brain.

Lyrics:
A Beautiful Day  
Chorus Rise up children, celebrate, it’s a wonderful world and a beautiful day 
Hold a hand, swing and sway, it’s a wonderful  world and beautiful day  
(children answer all parts) 
Birds are flying Squirrels are climbing 
Trees are swaying 
Children are playing
 Runners are running 
Hearts are thumping 
Dancers are hopping 
Rabbits are hopping 
  
Repeat Chorus  

Buses are driving 
Jets are flying 
Guitars are strumming 
Friends are hugging 
Tails are wagging
 Hands are clapping 
Fish – ees are swishing
 Mommies are kissing   

Repeat Chorus

snippet.title: Family & Kids 'Brain Break' Home Workout | # BB4 Fit Dad TV
snippet.description:
Welcome to a NEW Family 'Brain Break' Home Workout for families, parents and kids to help you take a healthy break and exercise at home.

This is # 4 ‘On The Floor!’

Exercise is a great way to feel good and these fun quick workouts can be done by all the family together and help you feel happier, fitter, stronger and more motivated.

Remember to subscribe to my channel and please let me know how I can help you in the comments. And below is the fitness information and helpful tips for this workout video.

Let’s Do It,
Tristan ✌🏼 🤟🏼

——————————————————————————————————————————
🇬🇧Subscribe to my fitness channel here
https://bit.ly/3dvVm7Y
🔔And also turn on the bell notification so you don't miss the next ColorFit Workout.

Thanks for all your support! Remember to share, comment and click the ‘thumbs up’ too :)
——————————————————————————————————————————

⭐️WORKOUT SPECS:

Up to 1 minute prep
Each exercise 30 seconds (unless I change it :)

1 circuit for a quick 'brain break' workout
2 circuits for intermediate.
3 for a real challenging workout.
(2-3 minute rest between circuits)

Check out any of my other ColorFit Workouts if you want to try other workouts.




⭐️NOTES:  All my follow along workout videos are in 2 PARTS:

 1. Every workout video has an INTRODUCTION section first.
 2. And each ColorFit Workout begins when you see my ‘Sessions Timer Bar’ pop up above my head.

⭐️WHAT ARE COLORFIT WORKOUTS?

snippet.title: Penguin Song | Penguin Dance | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
The Penguin Dance is a super fun song for brain breaks. The Penguin Dance uses a growing pattern to teach left and right, following directions, listening skills and develops gross motor movement skills.  We mirror left and right sides to make it easy to follow.  

Brain research suggests that physical activity like engaging in my fun movements songs like Penguin Dance, increases a student’s ability to process and retain new material.

I think brain breaks should be fun! Parent, teachers and kids all love the Penguin Dance.

Brain Breaks including songs like the Penguin Dance help your children rejuvenate and re-focus on learning.

The Penguin Dance is on my Get on Board the Transition Train album.
https://www.jackhartmann.com/album/transition-songs-get-on-board-the-transition-train/

You can find this video on the Learning Rocks: Math Skills DVD. https://www.jackhartmann.com/dvd/educational-videos-learning-rocks-vol-1/

Penguins recorded at Tampa's Lowry Park Zoo.

Educational Song Lyrics:
Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see Chorus
Penguins attention, penguins begin

Right flipper
Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see 
Right flipper, Left flipper

Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see 
Right flipper, Left flipper, Right leg

Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see 
Right flipper, Left flipper, Right leg, Left leg

Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see 
Right flipper, Left flipper, Right leg, Left leg, Head

Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see 
Right flipper, Left flipper, Right leg, Left leg, Head, Turn around

Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see 
Right flipper, Left flipper, Right leg, Left leg, Head, Turn around, Penguin sound

Have you ever seen a penguin come to tea
When you look at me a penguin you will see 
Penguins Attention!

snippet.title: Gratitude for Kids | Meditation for Children | Brain Breaks
snippet.description:
This video helps to generate more gratitude by focusing on the people and things kids are thankful for. Science has shown that gratitude increases happiness, social connection, lowers blood pressure and improves sleep. Follow along here on our guided mindfulness activity and you'll start learning a lifelong habit that has tremendous health benefits. Did you know that meditating for at least 10 mins a day helps achieve a happier mindset? Remember that learning any skill takes practice. Try to do at least one mindfulness exercise each day. 

Try another mindfulness activity:
https://youtu.be/w5jgfxvbkiY

https://youtu.be/wRDpCYeOhxk

snippet.title: Online Class #53 ♫ Wishy Washy Washer Woman & More ♫ Kids Songs by The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Welcome to The Learning Station online/virtual class #53 for kids and children. Online Kids Class #53 will include: ♫ Music and movement & learning fun for preschoolers by The Learning Station (Also, known as Learning Station). Here is a list of the educational action, movement, and fun learning songs we will be performing today: 
❤ Wishy Washy Washer Woman
❤ Tony Chestnut
❤ Goldilocks and the 3 Bears
❤ Singing In the Rain with Matt from Dream English


“Wishy Washy Washer Woman”: Sing and dance as you learn the dance moves and actions to our popular silly song for kids; dance, camp, brain break and action song. #1 Best kid’s songs for preschool, kindergarten & elementary: “Wishy Washy Washer Woman” song includes lyrics and dance moves. This kids song is ideal for dance, camp and brain breaks for kids! Wishy Washy Washer Woman, is on the award-winning CD, #1 Best Kid's Songs!  ♫ “#1 Best Kid's Songs” CD and CD Download: https://www.learningstationmusic.com

“Wishy Washy Washer Woman” (Silly Songs for Kids)
From the CD "#1 Best Kid's Songs!”
By The Learning Station®
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station 
Lyrics and dance moves:
(Follow the silly dance moves to this popular kids song; camp, action and brain break songs for children.)
“Wishy Washy Washer Woman”                                                                                                                               LYRICS:
Way down in the valley where nobody goes, there’s a wishy, washy washer woman washin’ her clothes. She goes, “Ooh Ah, Ooh Ah.” She goes, “Ooh Ah, Ooh Ah.” She goes, “Ooh Ah, Ooh Ah.” She goes, “Ooh Ah, Ooh Ah.” That’s how the wishy, washy washer woman washes her clothes. 
Hey, washer woman!  Hey, washer woman! Ooh Ah! Ooh Ah!
Hey, washer woman!  Hey, washer woman! Ooh Ah! Ooh Ah!  
 
Way down in the valley where nobody goes, there’s a wishy, washy washer woman dryin’ her clothes. She goes, “Puff Ah, Puff Ah.” She goes, “Puff Ah, Puff Ah.” She goes, “Puff Ah, Puff Ah.” She goes, “Puff Ah, Puff Ah.” That’s how the wishy, washy washer woman dries her clothes.

snippet.title: This or That Dance Party Mash-Up #3, Exercise, Fitness, Brain Break, Physical Education, FUN 4 KIDS!
snippet.description:
This or That Dance Party Mash-Up #3 
Let's have more fun at school! Get your students moving with these fun dance moves!! 
6 Minutes

During this video, students are expected to choose a dance move that is shown on the screen (this or that). Each dance slide will last for 25 seconds before changing. The music in the video will motivate and inspire your students. You can also encourage your students to simply dance along with their very own groovy style!!

Health and physical education offers students a unique opportunity for kinesthetic learning – they learn about healthy, active living primarily by “doing”, that is, through physical activity. In health and physical education, students discover the joy of movement, learn about their bodies, and develop physical and cognitive skills that will contribute to their lifelong health and well-being.

snippet.title: Boom Chicka Boom | Boom Chicka Boom Brain Breaks | Brain Breaks | Jack Hartmann
snippet.description:
Boom Chicka Boom is a perfect brain breaks song children love! I put a new twist on this favorite children's song with fun characters (surfers, Hip-Hop singers) and creative silly movements (yucky style, spooky ghost style).

Boom Chicka Boom is a wonderful "repeat after me" song can be used not only as a brain break in the classroom, but in physical education classes to get students moving and having fun.

In addition to using this for your brain breaks, Boom Chicka Boom highlights another educational skill, phonological awareness (reading skill)! All the ending sounds in Boom Chicka Boom sound alike except for Yo at the end. The yo was just for fun because children really like the pose.

James, my music partner, and I made the music in this version really rock! Your children will love the cool music and great beat to my new version of Boom Chicka Boom!

I'm so happy to this song and video to your children and we thought it was important to include a beautiful diversity of children. They had lots of fun shooting this video, Boom Chicka Boom.

Brain Breaks can be enjoyed in the classroom, physical education classes or at home! Watch Boom Chicka Boom again to really get those wiggles out!


LYRICS:

Boom Chicka Boom  
Words and Music by Jack Hartmann, MA, BMI  Copyright 2015


This is a repeat after me song
Say what I say, do what I do, let’s have fun!

I said a boom chicka rocka chicka rocka chicka boom
Uh huh, oh yeah, one more time

Uh huh, oh yeah, one more time

Surfer style

I said a boom surfer dude
I said a boom chicka rocka chicka rocka surfer dude
Uh huh, oh yeah, one more time

Spooky ghost style

I said a Boom Chicka Boo 
I said a boom chicka rocka chicka rocka chicka Boo
Uh huh, oh yeah, one more time 

Yucky style
I said a Boom Chicka ewwwww
I said a Boom Chicka ewwwww
I said a boom chicka rocka chicka rocka chicka ewwwww
Uh huh, oh yeah, one more time

Rapper style
I said a Boom Chicka yo
I said a Boom Chicka yo
I said a boom chicka rocka chicka rocka chicka yo
Uh huh, oh yeah, yo, yo, yo, Boom Chicka Boom, yo

snippet.title: Body Boogie Dance | Kids Song | Brain Break
snippet.description:
Dance and sing with Mimi and Gabi-Roo to Body Boogie! A great song to learn body parts and to get the body moving. Great exercise song for kids and parents or as a brain break in the classroom. A whole-brain whole-body approach to learning about our bodies and how exercise and movement keep them healthy. This is also a great song for learners of English as a second language. Aprender ingles con Mimi. Aprendre anglais avec Mimi. Seek lyrics below.

If you want to learn the dance, check out our dance tutorial video!

Body Boogie Lyrics
Verse 1
Tap your feet, clap your hands to the rhythm
Nod your head, touch your nose, bend your knees
Chorus 1
Sway your hips, turn around
Reach your hands to the ground
And jump to the Body Boogie with me
Verse 2
Click your fingers in time to the music
Shrug your shoulders and grin with your teeth
Chorus 2
Throw your hands in the air
Close your eyes if you dare
And jump to the Body Boogie with me
Bridge
Move your feet, move your arms, sway your hips and your knees
Move your head, move your shoulders and grin with your teeth
Chorus 2
Throw your hands in the air
Close your eyes if you dare
And jump to the Body Boogie with me
Chorus 1
Sway your hips, turn around
Reach your hands to the ground
And dance to the Body Boogie with me

snippet.title: Apples and Bananas ♫ + More Favorite Children's Songs ♫ Best Kids Songs ♫ The Learning Station
snippet.description:
Apples and Bananas is a favorite children’s song! Top 10 #1 Best Kids Songs for Children: This collection of favorite and popular kids songs features: “Apples and Bananas”, “Boom Chicka Boom”, “Go Bananas”, “Down by the Bay”, “Move and Freeze”, “Herman the Worm”, “Shake Your Sillies Out” and more favorites and best kids songs! 
Apples and Bananas
From the CD, Nursery Rhymes with The Learning Station 
by The Learning Station®                                                               
℗©Monopoli/The Learning Station (All rights reserved.)
LYRICS:
“Apples and Bananas” 
I like to eat, eat, eat, apples and bananas. I like to eat, eat, eat, apples and bananas. “Your turn.”
(I like to eat, eat, eat, apples and bananas.)  (I like to eat, eat, eat, apples and bananas.)
“Now change those sounds to an A.”

I like to ate, ate, ate, ay-ples and ba-nay nays. I like to ate, ate, ate, ay-ples and ba-nay nays. “Your turn.”
(I like to ate, ate, ate, ay-ples and ba-nay nays. I like to ate, ate, ate, ay-ples and ba-nay nays.) 
“Now, change those A sounds to an E.”

I like to eat, eat, eat, ee-ples and bee nee nees. I like to eat, eat, eat, ee-ples and bee nee nees. “Your turn.”
(I like to eat, eat, eat, ee-ples and bee nee nees. I like to eat, eat, eat, ee-ples and bee nee nees.)
“Now, change those E sounds to an I.”

I like to ite, ite, ite, ii-ples and bii nii niies. I like to ite, ite, ite, ii-ples and bii nii niies. “Your turn.”
(I like to ite, ite, ite, ii-ples and bii nii niies.) (I like to ite, ite, ite, ii-ples and bii nii niies.) 
“Now, change those I sounds to an O.”

I like to ote, ote, ote, op-ples and bo-no-nos. I like to ote, ote, ote, op-ples and bo-no-nos. “Your turn.”
(I like to ote, ote, ote, op-ples and bo-no-nos.) (I like to ote, ote, ote, op-ples and bo-no-nos.)
“Now, change those O sounds to a U.”

I like to ute, ute, ute, up-ples and bu-nu-nus. I like to ute, ute, ute, up-ples and bu-nu-nus. “Your turn.”
(I like to ute, ute, ute, up-ples and bu-nu-nus.) (I like to ute, ute, ute, up-ples and bu-nu-nus.)
Now, were going to change those U sounds and go back to the beginning.

And that's the end to our Apples and Bananas Song.

snippet.title: Clap Along 1 | Brain Breaks | Green Bean's Music | Interactive Songs
snippet.description:
Clap Along 1 is the first of an upcoming series of interactive brain breaks geared towards preschoolers and up. You can clap along or use instruments like; recorders, drums and rattles. 

In this video the voice and number that shows on screen indicates how many times to clap along (1,2 or 3). Instruct children to pay attention as it will gradually get faster.

If you enjoy this video comment below and let us know!
